text: A social interaction or social relation is the way people talk and act with each other.Argyle, M. (2017). Social interaction: process and products. Routledge.Becker, G. S. (1974). A theory of social interactions. Journal of political economy, 82(6), 1063-1093. It may include interactions in a team, family or bureaucracy. It includes any relationship between two or more individuals. It is a source of socialization and it characterizes all types of social relationships. According to Gish and N.P, " Social interaction is the reciprocal influence human beings exert on each other through inter stimulation and response." ==References== Category:Sociology Category:Communication
